original: Leijonhufvud, Abraham Karlsson, friherre, brandchef, Linköping, f. 14/ 10/03 i Näs’hulta, Södermani. 1., av kapt., frih. Karl Axel Karlsson L. o. frihian Anna Margareta L. G. 34 m. Torhild Cleve. Barn: Anna Birgitta (Bitti) f. 34. — Läroverksstudier 13-24, reservoff rexamen 26, brandbefälsutbildn. i Sthlm, Borås, Luleå o. Linköp. 27-32, stud. v. Düsseldorfs o. Hamburgs brandkårer 28. Kapt. i Livgrenadj :reg. res. 42. V. brandchef i Linköp. 33, brandchef där sed. 37. Brandkonsulent i Östergötl. brandkårsförb. (västra distr.). Hobby: filateli (medl. av Sv:es filatelistfören. sed. 39). RLSF:s ftjt i silver 42, i guld 44, Sv. scoutrådets förb:lilja 45.
translated: Leijonhufvud, Abraham Karlsson, Baron, fire chief, Linköping, b. 14/10/03 in Näs'hulta, Södermani. Son of Captain and Baron Karl Axel Karlsson L. and Baroness Anna Margareta L. Married to Torhild Cleve in 1934. Children: Anna Birgitta (Bitti) b. 1934. Attended secondary school from age 13 to 24, completed reserve officer examination in 1926, completed fire officer training in Stockholm, Borås, Luleå, and Linköping from 1927 to 1932. Studied at fire departments in Düsseldorf and Hamburg in 1928. Became Captain of the Life Grenadier Regiment in 1942. Vice fire chief in Linköping from 1933, fire chief from 1937. Fire consultant in Östergötland Fire Brigade Association (western district). Hobby: philately (member of the Swedish Philatelic Association since 1939). Recipient of the Royal Lifesaving Society silver medal in 1942, gold medal in 1944, and Swedish Scout Council's association lily in 1945.
